result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant opts to wait for PD appointment as opposed to court-appointed attorney.

Court finds good cause to extend time limits within which to conduct the preliminary examination.  Court date is reset.

The original history event date is: 07-07-2022

BAIL HEARING - 
Defendant in custody and appearing by video from the Manitowoc County Jail.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crimes of felony bail jumping, disorderly conduct-dvo, criminal damage to property-dvo, disorderly conduct and resist/obstruct officer.  The matters are continued for initial appearance on 07-11-22 at 1:30 p.m. Br. 1.  Bail is set at $500.00 cash with the conditions that he have no contact with S.B., DOB: 08-28-1990 and 425 E. Main Street, Mishicot, WI 54228.  Bail not furnished and defendant is remanded into custody.  Commitment for failure to furnish bail issued.  Copy filed.  Court orders photos and prints at MTSO.
Minutes.
